page.title: 07BELMONT PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The only place of{education}in the area is the County Primary School in Ryecroft Lane,Belmont.The present building was built in 1898 and consists of a hall,two classrooms,a kitchen where meals are prepared,an office and cloakrooms.There is also an extensive playground and a small garden.The school has 38 pupils, consisting of 22{juniors}and 16 {infants.}There are two full time teachers and some ancillary staff. Most of the children come from the village and surrounding farms,but a few live in Bolton.The school has a variety of activities,including a gymnastic club,concerts for public performance twice a year and sports events with other schools.Swimming {lessons}involve a journey to Darwen Baths.
